content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Easy to understand (for me, I think).
If you're making a sequal to this, include these: modulo, increment, decrement, exponent, and percent.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looking forward to a possible medium version.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice idea, loved the concept

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The contribution effectively presents a straightforward yet engaging challenge with clear instructions and comprehensive test cases. Good work maintaining focus and clarity throughout. Well done.

Goal
* Please format "ADD", "SUB", "REPEAT" and "EXIT" as {{constants}} instead of [[variables]].

* Please format "X" and "N" as [[variables]].

* Please explain how the instructions should be ordered.

Inputs
* Please change "signs" to "operators".

Output
* Please specify that the output must contain one instruction per line.

Constraints
* Please change "line.length()" to "length of input expression".

* Please add "in the input expression" after "All numbers".

Stub generator
* Please change "statement" to "expression".

* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write instructions".

Cases
* Each test should be similar to but different from its corresponding validator. Please revise all the validators accordingly.

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks.

Thank you (5DN1L1) for the detailed feedback!
All suggested changes have been applied:

Goal: Replaced [[ADD]], [[SUB]], [[REPEAT]], and [[EXIT]] with {{constants}}; X and N are now [[variables]].

Clarified how instructions should be ordered based on computation flow and REPEAT grouping rules.

Inputs: Replaced "signs" with "operators".

Output: Added that the output must contain "one instruction per line".

Constraints: Reworded line.length() to "length of input expression", and specified that numbers are between 1 and 9 "in the input expression".

Stub generator: Replaced "statement" with "expression", and added a "write instructions" line.

Test cases: Validators have been revised to differ from their corresponding test cases while remaining logically aligned.

Thank you. Below is the updated list of comments:

Tags
* Please change "map" to "Hash tables" (better to use an existing tag than creating a new one).

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write instructions".

Cover picture
* Suggest to upload a cover picture for the puzzle.

Thanks again for the follow-up!

Tags: Replaced "map" with "Hash tables" as suggested.

Stub generator: Added the write instructions statement to match output requirements.

Cover picture: A cover image has now been uploaded for the puzzle.
